poem:
**Gap Redefined**

A swift logo,  
woven stitches  
on Timothée's  
shoulder  
glimmer under  
the dress-light,  
edged by  
Demi's mindful  
stride—  
  
once forgotten  
off-rack, now  
an echo,  

fashion speaks  
through soft cotton,  
breathes  
beneath each  
flashbulb's  
caress.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Grab your logo sweatshirt – Gap is making a surprise fashion comeback This year’s awards season brought a surprise fashion comeback: Gap. Everyone from Timothée Chalamet and Demi Moore to Cynthia Erivo and Anne Hathaway has worn the US high-street brand on the red carpet in the past year, and this month parent company Gap Inc released its most recent financial results – with sales up 7%. Joy Montgomery, commerce editor at Vogue, describes Hathaway’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
